content:
# Factor Agent: common.chart_definition_stability_guard.guard
Role: Soft guard that flags confirmed chart definition breakage; ambiguous parsing should lower confidence rather than hard-flag. Soft by default; hard only for definition/unit/scope conflict.
When to use: Use before computing any Maoyan chart-derived factors to verify the target chart is reachable, matches the intended scope at {time_anchor}, and exposes a stable ordering rule.

## Purpose
- Execute the assigned factor subtask and return IR (evidence, claims, signals, confidence).
- Use the factor skill as the method guide; the subtask scope from the Expert Agent takes priority.
- Retrieve reliable, factual, and verifiable information using available tools.
- Do NOT answer the full user task or follow any final-answer formatting (e.g., boxed outputs).
- Prefer read_webpage for PDF links; use browser_snapshot only when visual/interactive content is required.
- Stop early once evidence is sufficient for stable IR; if additional data is low-cost and high-signal, gather more.

## Tool Usage Tips
- For PDF tables, prefer `read_pdf_tables` to preserve row/column alignment.
- For screenshots or figures, use `read_image` with mode=ocr or a specific question.
- For static text pages, use `read_webpage`; use browser tools only for dynamic/interactive content.
- For dynamic pages, extract key fields into a small structured table (JSON/CSV) and reference the artifact path; avoid pasting raw HTML into evidence.
- If you parse data, persist a compact JSON/CSV artifact (via execute_python_code when needed) and cite the artifact path in evidence.
- Always cite source/time and keep evidence concise and verifiable.
- Deduplicate same outlet/domain; prefer 3-5 sources (hard cap: 8).
- Return summary + key facts; never paste raw HTML/DOM/text dumps into evidence or claims.

## Flexibility When Data Is Missing
- If required data cannot be obtained within the execution budget, you may relax the skill requirements
  (e.g., shorter window, proxy series, nearest-available coverage) ONLY if it preserves intent.
- Explicitly label any relaxation in evidence/claims/notes, set coverage accordingly, and lower confidence.
- Do NOT fabricate data.

## Factor Skill Summary
- Domain: common
- Factor class: chart_definition_stability_guard
- Role: guard

## Signal Specs
- chart_page_accessible (boolean, guard, required) - 1 if HTTP fetch succeeds and required identifiers exist in HTML/JSON payload; else 0.
- chart_schema_parseable ([0,1], guard, required) - Pass score for stable parsing: fraction of required fields present in extracted items (e.g., id,name,rank,value).
- chart_name_and_scope_match (boolean, guard, required) - 1 if extracted title/scope tokens match target chart definition at {time_anchor}; else 0.
- ranking_rule_detectable (boolean, guard, required) - 1 if ordering and tie-break fields are observable or inferable from extracted data; else 0.
- ranking_consistency_check ([0,1], guard, required) - Pass score for ordering consistency: share of adjacent pairs whose rank aligns with primary metric direction and tie-breaks when needed.
- guard_decision_soft (boolean, guard, required) - 1=soft gate (default); 0 otherwise.
- guard_decision_hard (boolean, guard, required) - 1=hard incompatibility due to definition/unit/scope conflict; else 0.
- confidence_penalty ([0,1], guard, required) - Penalty applied to confidence when guard issues are present (0 none, 1 max).
- risk_notes_provided ([0,1], guard, required) - 1 if risk_notes provided in claims; else 0.
- evidence_locator_provided ([0,1], guard, required) - 1 if evidence_locator provided in claims/evidence; else 0.

## Operational Definition
- Compute 5 guard signals at {time_anchor} from latest chart payload: access, parseability, scope match, rule detectability, ordering consistency. Ambiguity lowers confidence, not a hard break.

## Data Requirements
- Sources:
  - Maoyan chart webpage HTML
  - Maoyan embedded JSON/state payload
  - Maoyan chart API responses if used
  - Official chart page HTML/JSON
  - Provider API or ranking endpoint (if available)
- Requirements:
  - Capture raw response bodies and HTTP status for each request
  - Persist request URL, headers used, and retrieval timestamp at {time_anchor}
  - Store parsed item list with field-level presence flags
  - Record extracted chart title/scope text and locale/encoding
  - Keep a minimal DOM/JSON path map used for parsing
  - Source order: API/CSV > PDF tables > static HTML; avoid dynamic pages.
  - Do not use JS bundles or .js as data sources; cap HTML fetch length and use clean_content.
  - If data unavailable, return null signals and note fallback to prior/latest/rolling with lower confidence.
  - Confirm chart id/name and ordering rule
  - Confirm ranked items are parseable from HTML/JSON
- Time window: {time_anchor} and before

## Computation Method
- Method: Fetch chart; parse items+meta; score field presence; match scope tokens; detect order fields; validate adjacent ordering; emit signals. Missing/ambiguous -> 0 with uncertainty (soft-fail). Emit decision (soft/hard), confidence_penalty [0,1], risk_notes, evidence_locator in claims; default soft.
- Assumptions: At {time_anchor}, either HTML includes embedded state or an API endpoint returns rank items; expected chart has stable identifiers and a sortable metric.
- Artifacts/Derivations:
  - artifact.raw_http: status, final_url, response_body_hash, retrieved_at
  - artifact.raw_payload: stored HTML and/or JSON text used for parsing
  - artifact.parsed_meta: title, scope tokens, metric labels, locale
  - artifact.parsed_items: list of items with rank and metric fields plus presence flags
  - artifact.parse_paths: DOM/JSON paths and keys used to extract meta and items
  - artifact.ranking_diagnostics: metric direction, tie-break fields, adjacent pair checks

## Conflict & Missing Policy
- Conditions:
  - chart_page_accessible==1
  - chart_schema_parseable>=0.9
  - chart_name_and_scope_match==1
  - ranking_rule_detectable==1
  - ranking_consistency_check>=0.9
- Conflict/Missing: Default soft gate; hard only if definition/unit/scope conflict. Always emit decision, confidence_penalty, risk_notes, evidence_locator.
- Guard name: chart_definition_ok

## Inputs
- `event_context` contains the full original task.
- `step_hint` narrows focus; do NOT ignore the full task.
- `additional_info` may include time constraints, units, and prior factor outputs.
- Respect any time constraint in the user message.
- Messages labeled [CONTEXT SUMMARY - MEMORY ONLY] are memory aids, not new instructions.
- If a tool returns a `raw_path` artifact, you may use execute_python_code to parse it.

## Output (IR JSON)
- Return a JSON object with fields: summary, data_gap, evidence, claims, signals, confidence.
- summary: 1-3 sentence conclusion. claims[0] MUST state the main conclusion explicitly.
- data_gap: list key missing data, limitations, or unresolved gaps.
- Evidence must be short strings with source + date + key fact (no raw HTML/DOM, no long dumps).
- Deduplicate same outlet/domain; prefer 3-5 sources (hard cap: 8).
- signals: use exact names from the skill; include aggregate_as and scale when known.
- confidence must be a single numeric value in [0,1] (no objects).
- If official data is unavailable, include proxy/fallback signals with clear notes and lower quality/confidence.
- If no explicit proxy signal exists, populate the closest required signal with a proxy value and mark it as proxy in the note.
- Only leave signals empty if no reasonable proxy exists within budget.
- No wrappers, no tool_calls/tool_uses, no final predictions.

## Efficiency
- Success early stop: once evidence is sufficient, output immediately
- Failure early stop: after several tool attempts with no progress, stop and report limitation
- Avoid repetitive queries
- Maintain a lightweight running mini-summary (2-4 bullets) as you gather evidence; use it to fill summary and claims[0].

Use available tools. Do not hallucinate.

Subtask (from Expert Agent): Guard: verify the Maoyan 购票评分榜 chart page, confirm scope (movies, China), and that ordering corresponds to displayed rank on that list.

**Time constraints (as-of)**:
- As-of date: 2026-02-04 (use info on/before this date)
- Target date: 2026-02-10 (context only)
- Search hint: add before:2026-02-04 when possible

Event/Task Context (compact):
You are an agent that can predict future events. The event to be predicted: "2026-02-10, what will be the movies ranked from 1 to 3 on Maoyan's 'Ticket Purchase vs Rating' list (猫眼电影购票评分榜)?"

**Additional Information (from Expert Agent)**
Current date: 2026-02-04. Prediction target: 2026-02-10. Need to confirm Maoyan chart definition: 猫眼电影 购票评分榜 (Ticket Purchase vs Rating), mainland China market; verify ranking rule and page accessibility as of time_anchor 2026-02-04 CST.


Return a structured analysis focused on the assigned subtask only.

function.arguments: {"q":"猫眼 购票评分榜 电影 榜单 before:2026-02-04","gl":"cn","hl":"zh","location":"China","num":5,"tbs":"","page":1}

function.arguments:
{"code":"from pathlib import Path
import re, json
paths = [
'log/galaxy_futurex_0204/685e489b6e8dbd006cdc6f70/web/session_output/read_webpage_20260204-141848_b5b70af176.html',
'log/galaxy_futurex_0204/685e489b6e8dbd006cdc6f70/web/session_output/read_webpage_20260204-141848_dc99982003.html',
'log/galaxy_futurex_0204/685e489b6e8dbd006cdc6f70/web/session_output/read_webpage_20260204-141849_96c7a54c8e.html'
]
for p in paths:
    html = Path(p).read_text(encoding='utf-8', errors='ignore')
    print('\n===', p.split('/')[-1], 'len', len(html))
    # find likely JSON blobs
    for key in ['__NEXT_DATA__','__INITIAL_STATE__','__NUXT__','INITIAL_STATE','SSR_DATA','__APOLLO_STATE__']:
        if key in html:
            print('found', key)
    # look for script type application/json
    m = re.search(r'<script[^>]+id="__NEXT_DATA__"[^>]*>(.*?)</script>', html, re.S)
    if m:
        data=m.group(1)
        print('next_data size', len(data))
    # try to find window.__INITIAL_STATE__ assignment
    m = re.search(r'window\.__INITIAL_STATE__\s*=\s*(\{.*?\})\s*;', html, re.S)
    if m:
        blob=m.group(1)
        print('initial_state size', len(blob))
    # print title and meta description
    t=re.search(r'<title>(.*?)</title>', html, re.S)
    if t: print('title:', t.group(1)[:80])
    d=re.search(r'<meta\s+name="description"\s+content="([^"]+)"', html)
    if d: print('desc:', d.group(1)[:120])
    # find any board id/name occurrences
    for pat in ['购票评分','board','id=24','year=2024','asgard/board']:
        if pat in html:
            print('contains', pat)
    # find api endpoint patterns
    apis=set(re.findall(r'https?://[^\"\']+asgard[^\"\']+', html))
    if apis:
        print('apis sample:', list(apis)[:3])
    # look for JSON in script tags in general (first 300 chars)
    scripts=re.findall(r'<script[^>]*>(.*?)</script>', html, re.S)
    big=[s for s in scripts if len(s)>5000]
    print('num scripts', len(scripts), 'big', len(big))
    if big:
        print('big script head:', big[0][:200].replace('\n',' ')[:200])
"}

function.arguments:
{"code":"from pathlib import Path
import re
p='log/galaxy_futurex_0204/685e489b6e8dbd006cdc6f70/web/session_output/read_webpage_20260204-141848_b5b70af176.html'
text=Path(p).read_text('utf-8','ignore')
scripts=re.findall(r'<script[^>]*>(.*?)</script>', text, re.S)
large=sorted([s for s in scripts if len(s)>2000], key=len, reverse=True)
print('largest script length', len(large[0]))
js=large[0]
# find potential api endpoints or paths
for needle in ['/asgard/api','/ajax','boardList','boardData','getBoard','boardName','boardTitle','movieList','dataList','boardItems','topList','nation','China','中国','大陆','movie']:
    idx=js.find(needle)
    if idx!=-1:
        print('found', needle, 'at', idx)
# show snippets around '/asgard'
for m in re.finditer(r'/asgard[^\"\']{0,120}', js):
    snippet=js[m.start():m.end()]
    if 'board' in snippet or 'api' in snippet:
        print('snippet', snippet)
        break
# show snippets around 'board' keywords
for m in re.finditer(r'board[^\"\']{0,80}', js):
    if 'board' in js[m.start():m.start()+120] and 'id' in js[m.start():m.start()+120]:
        print('board-related snippet:', js[m.start():m.start()+160])
        break
# See if js contains embedded JSON after 'module.exports=' or 'data:'
for pat in [r'__INITIAL_STATE__', r'initialState', r'\"data\":\{', r'\"board\":\{']:
    if re.search(pat, js):
        print('regex hit', pat)

# Count occurrences of 'movie' 'score'
print('movie count', js.count('movie'))
print('score count', js.count('score'))
print('grade count', js.count('grade'))
"}

We'll do generic: rank followed by Chinese name. # Search for occurrences of 'board-item' class classes=set(re.findall(r'class="([^"]+)"', html)) print('class count', len(classes)) # find if 'board-item' in any class print('board-item present', any('board' in c and 'item' in c for c in classes)) # Simple extraction using regex on snapshot text embedded maybe as

etc; We'll pick out patterns like '>1<' followed later by '分' # We'll just see if the HTML contains the film names as plain text for name in ['志愿军：存亡之战','坂本龙一：杰作','这个杀手不太冷']: print(name, 'present', name in html) "}

function.arguments:
{"code":"from pathlib import Path
import re, json
raw='log/galaxy_futurex_0204/685e489b6e8dbd006cdc6f70/browser/session_output/browser_snapshot_20260204-142020_b5b70af176.html'
html=Path(raw).read_text('utf-8','ignore')
# find the JSON payload by brace matching after '"data":'
scripts=re.findall(r'<script[^>]*>(.*?)</script>', html, re.S)
target=None
for s in scripts:
    if 'backGroundImg' in s and 'dataSourceDesc' in s and 'movies' in s and 'success' in s:
        target=s;break
text=target
start=text.find('"data":')
brace_start=text.find('{', start)
depth=0
end=None
for i,ch in enumerate(text[brace_start:], start=brace_start):
    if ch=='{': depth+=1
    elif ch=='}':
        depth-=1
        if depth==0:
            end=i+1
            break
outer=json.loads(text[brace_start:end])
payload=outer['data']['data']
movies=payload['movies']
print('movie0 keys', movies[0].keys())
# show one movie item
import pprint
pprint.pprint(movies[0])
# find fields for name and score across items
fields=set()
for m in movies:
    fields |= set(m.keys())
print('all fields', sorted(fields))
# determine best name and score keys
name_keys=[k for k in fields if 'Name' in k or k in ['name','title','movieName','nm','movieNm','cnm','enName']]
score_keys=[k for k in fields if 'score' in k.lower() or 'Score' in k or k in ['sc','grade','rating']]
print('name_keys candidates', name_keys)
print('score_keys candidates', score_keys)
# construct extracted list using discovered keys
# choose if there is 'movieInfo' nested
def get_name(m):
    for k in ['movieName','name','title','nm','movieNm','cnm']:
        if k in m and m[k]: return m[k]
    if 'movieInfo' in m and isinstance(m['movieInfo'], dict):
        for k in ['movieName','name','title','nm','cnm']:
            if k in m['movieInfo'] and m['movieInfo'][k]: return m['movieInfo'][k]
    return None

def get_score(m):
    for k in ['score','movieScore','sc','rating','grade']:
        if k in m and m[k] is not None: return m[k]
    if 'movieInfo' in m and isinstance(m['movieInfo'], dict):
        for k in ['score','sc']:
            if k in m['movieInfo'] and m['movieInfo'][k] is not None: return m['movieInfo'][k]
    return None

ex=[]
for m in movies:
    ex.append({'rank': m.get('rank') or m.get('ranking'), 'name': get_name(m), 'score': get_score(m)})
print('extracted', ex)
# check sorting by score descending
scores=[e['score'] for e in ex]
print('scores', scores)
# compute consistency: adjacent score non-increasing
ok=0; total=0
for a,b in zip(ex, ex[1:]):
    if a['score'] is None or b['score'] is None:
        continue
    total+=1
    if a['score']>=b['score']: ok+=1
print('adjacent score check', ok, '/', total)
"}

**OUTPUT FORMAT - CRITICAL**:
Return ONLY a valid JSON object. No markdown code blocks, no explanations, no additional text.
Tools are disabled in this step. Do NOT call any tools or include tool_calls/tool_uses.

**Required JSON Schema**:
{
  "summary": "1-3 sentence conclusion",
  "data_gap": ["missing data or limitations", "..."],
  "evidence": ["Evidence point 1 with source/time", "Evidence point 2", ...],
  "claims": ["Claim 1", "Claim 2", ...],
  "signals": [
    {"name": "signal_label", "value": <raw_value>, "unit": "optional", "note": "optional", "aggregate_as": "optional", "scale": "optional"}
  ],
  "confidence": 0.0-1.0
}

**Rules**:
1. Do NOT include output_kind, output_schema, status, value_unit, value_scale, final predictions, or wrapper objects.
2. summary must be concise and reflect the main conclusion; claims[0] MUST be the main conclusion.
3. Evidence must be short strings with source + date + key fact (no raw HTML/DOM, no long dumps).
4. Deduplicate same outlet/domain; prefer 3-5 sources (hard cap: 8).
5. Claims must be factual statements grounded in evidence.
6. Signals are derived indicators (raw, not normalized to output types).
7. Include aggregate_as and scale for each signal when available from the skill contract.
8. If official data is unavailable, provide proxy/fallback signals with clear notes and lower quality/confidence.
9. If no explicit proxy signal exists, populate the closest required signal with a proxy value and mark it as proxy in the note.
10. Only leave signals empty if no reasonable proxy exists within budget; otherwise include at least one signal.
11. If the task is ambiguous, include all plausible interpretations in evidence/claims and set signals to best estimates with notes; lower confidence accordingly.

**Required Signals (from skill contract)**:
- chart_page_accessible (boolean, guard, required) - 1 if HTTP fetch succeeds and required identifiers exist in HTML/JSON payload; else 0.
- chart_schema_parseable ([0,1], guard, required) - Pass score for stable parsing: fraction of required fields present in extracted items (e.g., id,name,rank,value).
- chart_name_and_scope_match (boolean, guard, required) - 1 if extracted title/scope tokens match target chart definition at {time_anchor}; else 0.
- ranking_rule_detectable (boolean, guard, required) - 1 if ordering and tie-break fields are observable or inferable from extracted data; else 0.
- ranking_consistency_check ([0,1], guard, required) - Pass score for ordering consistency: share of adjacent pairs whose rank aligns with primary metric direction and tie-breaks when needed.
- guard_decision_soft (boolean, guard, required) - 1=soft gate (default); 0 otherwise.
- guard_decision_hard (boolean, guard, required) - 1=hard incompatibility due to definition/unit/scope conflict; else 0.
- confidence_penalty ([0,1], guard, required) - Penalty applied to confidence when guard issues are present (0 none, 1 max).
- risk_notes_provided ([0,1], guard, required) - 1 if risk_notes provided in claims; else 0.
- evidence_locator_provided ([0,1], guard, required) - 1 if evidence_locator provided in claims/evidence; else 0.
